StudyInfo.StudyNameEntrez: NCI Expanded Genome-Wide Association Study of Renal Cell Carcinoma

Policy.acknowledgement_statement: The NCI expanded GWAS of RCC was funded by the Intramural Research Program of the National Cancer Institute, NIH. Information on collaborators and study-specific funding sources are provided in the following publication: Scelo G et al. PMID 28598434. The datasets have been accessed through the NIH database for Genotypes and Phenotypes (dbGaP). If these dataset(s) were used, please cite them in all oral or written presentations, disclosures, or publications.

GSR_Access.gsr_mode_label: Unrestricted access (institution responded that the study is not sensitive without submitting a new Institutional Certification)

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use
ConsentGroup.name: GRU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification.

ConsentGroup.title: General Research Use (IRB, NPU)
ConsentGroup.name: GRU-IRB-NPU
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data is limited only by the terms of the model Data Use Certification. Requestor must provide documentation of local IRB approval. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations.

ConsentGroup.title: Disease-Specific (Kidney Cancer)
ConsentGroup.name: DS-RCC
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: Use of the data must be related to Kidney Cancer.

ConsentGroup.title: Cancer in all age groups, other diseases in adults, and methods
ConsentGroup.name: CADM
ConsentGroup.Use-Restriction: The informed consent document signed by the PLCO study participants allows use of these data by investigators for discovery and hypothesis generation in the investigation of the genetic contributions to cancer and other adult diseases as well as development of novel analytical approaches for GWAS.
